creator: JakeThal
title: The RADbot
materials_required: Board camera with a USB outlet
Radioactive sample of sufficient activity (~5μSv or higher)
description: The RADbot is designed to assist astronauts on Mars by identifying radioactive rock samples and avoiding damage on the Martian terrain using cliff sensors, light sensors, bumper sensors, and a camera. It can also be used to locate uranium deposits for potential mining and power generation for a self-sustaining colony.
steps: Secure the Geiger-Muller counter to the Roomba, ensuring the sensor is not blocked.
Mount the camera to face the Geiger-Muller counter's display, positioning it close to minimize external interference and connecting it to the Raspberry Pi.
Connect the Raspberry Pi to the Roomba.
Download the Roomba toolbox and place it into the specified folders.
Connect to the Roomba using the command 'r=roomba(x)' in Matlab.
Create code to control the Roomba's speed based on light sensor readings to approach objects slowly.
Create bumper code to stop or reverse the Roomba upon physical impact.

Develop code to capture images of the Geiger-Muller counter screen, interpret the color data to determine radioactivity levels, and trigger an alert and evasive maneuvers if high activity is detected.
Create cliff sensor code to detect edges and trigger a backward movement and spinning action to alert astronauts.
